Chris, much as I don't like reasoning by analogies, your response is remarkably the same as the responses to ACC Theory, so this may have value.

If you want to contradict the prediction of "splat", you have to actually say something like:

1) "I predict no splat because James is a flying squirrel, with a gliding surface of x sq meters."

or, more ambitious:

2) "Gravity doesn't operate universally as we thought; James is composed of a class of matter that doesn't conform to the space-time continuum"

That's the problem that James keeps trying to point out (as do I); either you need an alternative Theory to ACC (2), or you have to make concrete predictions *within* ACC (1). In either case, you actually have to produce a clear statement that is subject to validation.

Just carping about how hard it all is, or throwing out words like parameter and viscosity, is not science. For the zillionth time---we don't discard theories because they make an inaccurate prediction. We modify them; any of you guys is welcome to produce a modification to ACC if it is consistent with the laws of physics and comes in the proper scientific form. Predict something, and give us the math and physics to back it up. And that doesn't mean a reference to some blog, it means using your own words to put your own proposals on the line.

Thanks in advance for your reply.
